titleStmt.title: J. S. Fisher et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2341

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Hon Wm Bramlett
Gov of the Common Wlth of Kentucky

The citizens of said Common Wealth residing in Milton destrict County of Trimble beg leave respectfully to petition your Hon to appoint Sanford B Kendall of said prescinct as Justice of the Peace for Milton Destrict in the place made vacant by the resignation of John M Abbott late Justice of the Peace. We the undersigned would represent to your Hon that we are well acquaint with said Kendall and take pleasure in saying that we believe him well qualified for the postion and assure your Hon that his appointment would give universal satisfaction to the citizens of this county Wherefore we ask that the said Kendall be appointed for which we will ever pray

J S. Fisher
M B Mosly
Jno Ely
H A Moore
Georg Salmiler
R M Nichols
P.S. King
Saml Morris
John M Abbott
Ambrose Estes
P. King,
E. L. Taulman
Daniel Donoven
James Hyet
Saml Flarn
John Courtny
Names
Philip Meissigar
Geo Metassin
Jame Ederds
John D Toombs
John Lyons
Andres Lutz
O Britton
John Nichols
L Wallace
Wm Sterling
S Kelso
Christopher Pecard
Albert Proad
Names
W B Watkins

Referd to Secty of State
Is there a vacancy? Enquire as to the loyalty of the man recommended?
